ROBBERY.Definition: the act of stealing from a person or place

MAFIA.Definition: an organised group involved in illegal activities

RESOURCE.Definition: a useful or valuable possession or source of supply

WAFFLES.Definition: a type of bread or cake made from batter

DRILLING.Definition: making a hole in it with a tool

SYPHONING.Definition: taking the liquid out of it

BARREL.Definition: a large container for storing liquids

STICKY.Definition: hard to move or separate because it is thick and gluey

QUOTAS.Definition: a set amount that is allowed or required

STABILISE.Definition: make steady or stop from changing

FLOODED.Definition: filled with too much of it

TAPPING.Definition: getting it by making a hole in them

HARVEST.Definition: the process of collecting or gathering the resource

FLUCTUATE.Definition: change or move up and down

EXCESS.Definition: an amount that is larger than allowed, surplus

KICKER.Definition: an unexpected or surprising part of the situation

BOOM.Definition: a time of fast growth or success

THRIVING.Definition: doing very well or growing strong

CRACKED DOWN.Definition: took strong action to stop them

FINES.Definition: money they had to pay as punishment

OPT OUT.Definition: choose not to follow the rules

EXCEEDED.Definition: went beyond the limit or expectation

SHUT DOWN.Definition: close or stop it from functioning

PILED.Definition: placed on top of each other

BACKGROUND CHECK.Definition: looking into his history to see if he was trustworthy

CONVICTED.Definition: found guilty of a crime in court

FRAUDSTER.Definition: a person who cheated or tricked others to get money

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: claims that he had done it, without proof yet

LOGISTICS.Definition: the planning and organisation of how things would be moved or done

FRINGES.Definition: the edges or outside parts of the business

ACCESS BADGES.Definition: cards or tags used to enter the area

STACKED.Definition: piled up on top of each other

STAMPED.Definition: marked with an official sign or symbol

POUR OUT.Definition: flow out or drop the liquid in large amounts

CRUNCH TIME.Definition: a critical moment when something important would happen

SPRAYING.Definition: sending out or applying in small amounts

WOBBLE.Definition: move unsteadily from side to side

TOPPLE.Definition: fall over because of being unsteady

WIGGLED.Definition: moved from side to side with small, quick movements

EXTENT.Definition: the scope or degree of it

INSIDE JOB.Definition: a crime done by someone within the warehouse

FORKLIFT TRUCK.Definition: a vehicle used to lift and move heavy items

SUSPECTS.Definition: people who were believed to have done it

DEEPER-ROOTED.Definition: more firmly established or fixed, more deeply held

DEEP-SEATED.Definition: strongly felt or held over a long time

EFFICACY.Definition: the ability to produce the desired effect
